item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 2:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Linear Algebra Done Right [pdf] (43 points | 10 comments)
2. Rediscovering Turbo Pascal (38 points | 5 comments)
3. Founder Mode (272 points | 166 comments)
4. The Design and Implementation of the CPython Virtual Machine (25 points | discuss)
5. Honey, I shrunk {fmt}: bringing binary size to 14k and ditching the C++ runtime (129 points | 48 comments)
6. Einstein's Other Theory of Everything (64 points | 14 comments)
7. Show HN: Linkpreview, see how your sites looks in social media and chat apps (15 points | 6 comments)
8. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (690 points | 75 comments)
9. Starliner crew reports hearing "sonar like noises" (34 points | 16 comments)
10. Playstation 2 GS emulation – the final frontier of Vulkan compute emulation (150 points | 37 comments)
11. Godot on iPad, Toolbars, Importers, Embedding, Debugger (42 points | 12 comments)
12. C Course Online (54 points | 7 comments)
13. Build Your Own Z80 Computer: Design Guidelines and Application (1981) (47 points | 5 comments)
14. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need (2022) [video] (369 points | 63 comments)
15. Hypothyroidism: The anonymous Olmec artisan and Velázquez (2017) (6 points | discuss)
16. E Ink faces growing competition in the "paper-like" display space (119 points | 59 comments)
17. Anarchy in Sudan has spawned the world’s worst famine in 40 years (139 points | 175 comments)
18. Did your car witness a crime? (244 points | 498 comments)
19. A better HTML input experience (custom elements and the AOM) (2017) (16 points | 3 comments)
20. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (116 points | 44 comments)
21. The Atari 7800 (48 points | 8 comments)
22. A brief history of barbed wire fence telephone networks (91 points | 9 comments)
23. MapRoulette: the micro-tasking tool for OpenStreetMap (76 points | 27 comments)
24. The web's clipboard, and how it stores data of different types (7 points | 1 comment)
25. Take a closer look at Starbucks CEO's contract, which covers his commute by jet (56 points | 7 comments)
26. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
27. Have we stopped to think about what LLMs model? (6 points | 3 comments)
28. The papers that most heavily cite retracted studies (44 points | 10 comments)
29. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (74 points | 35 comments)
30. HMD Barbie Phone (32 points | 42 comments)
